name: Connolly's
address: 121 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

reviews.text: Matthew is the man, great bar great vibes
Fantastic place everyone so friendly
This is one of my favorite place in  Alexandria. Always stop here for a beer. Amazing place and servers.
Food just ok. Staff disengaged. Food orders mixed up. Poor atmosphere, and we felt rushed. We had picked it as a venue for a birthday dinner but I'd say there's multiple better venues in new York.

A really great place! My friends and I really enjoyed the service, and the food was incredibly delicious. Our waitress, Gina, was very pleasant and helped us with our choices. During our next visit to New York, we‚Äôll definitely come here again!

Had to have a Guinness in New York so popped into Connollys
. decided to eat, do ordered Shepherds pie and Irish stew.
Both meals arrived, hot but not piping hot. Tasted good which compensated slightly.

2 beers + 2 main meals + tax + 20% gratuity ( which I felt was excessive and shouldn't automatically be applied to the bill).
Overall, it was ok, nothing special.
Would I visit again?
No
The flavors in the dish were amazing, and the meal was satisfying

Exceeded my expectations. üëèüëèüëè This s a gem. The beers on tap are stellar. The beer lines are calibrated and cleaned and ON POINT.  I ordered the Bangers and Mash with a side of curry fries.  Everyone, this is Legit* (see attached photos). Also, this pub and its staff prides themselves on being the very best.  Indeed. As an expert on service of excellents, this ...this will meet your expectations and beyond. Kudos Connolly, you would be proud üëè
Good food and drink. Convenient spot before theatre
J'ai bien bu ! L'ambiance est top ! C'est beau !
Stopped in before flight to airport. Service was great and staff was friendly.

Love this bar near times square and the theaters. Had the fish and chips which were crispy, fluffy with a tasty bear batter. The shepherd's pie was very flavorful with lots of meatsnd gravy. Excellent meal before seeing a show.

Pretty standard pub food nothing special. Decent enough pint.

Gaelic burger comes with chips (fries üá∫üá∏üá∫üá∏üá∫üá∏) ($22), pint of Guinness ($10)‚Ä¶
Fun place, loud - but it's supposed to be!  Friendly service and tons going on - great place to watch sports with friends!

Overpriced rip off, $57 for two Jameson‚Äôs and Lemonade - challenged the bartender on this and was told that‚Äôs the price with‚Äôgratuity‚Äô - went in O‚ÄôHara‚Äôs much nicer experience - same drinks $22.00, better location, able to chat about 911 and give my respects as a Fire Officer in the UK
Spent all afternoon and a great deal of money enjoying our time. Strange that Brits can be treated so differently in an Irish Bar
Terrible experience for pick up of an order. They had no idea what was going on for the longest time. Kept delaying and attending to others.
Non abbiamo provato il ristorante solo il Pub al piano superiore. Bel locale con una gran variet√† di birre alla spina anche locali e un men√π di cocktails. Servizio veloce. Prezzo onesti.
An Irish pub in manhattan, how good can it be? Well actually pretty decent. Amazing range of drinks, nice layout, attentive staff, give it a go.

Made this my base when I was in New York, excellent breakfast and very much value for money, lunch and dinner was also eaten and was excellent. Can highly recommend the fish and chips and the baked potatoes.

Cold bottled beers and excellent selection of draught beers.
Personale gentile e preparato. Ottima posizione. Prezzi mella media
My favorite dish was bangers and mash. You can not go wrong here. Delicious.
Food was great,got wings and loaded nachos,highly recommended!
The manager is the best!!!ü•Ç Love this guy!
I ordered Mississippi Mud and Chicken Teriyaki.
Our waitress was great quick and to the point. Would come again
Excellent little spot. Food was good, service was friendly, and it was reasonably priced.
Such a fantastic bar with amazing staff Michael was really helpful and gave us tips on places to go
Don't hesitate
Love Connoly‚Äôs! A go- to for us when we‚Äôre in Fort Myers. The lobster-crab bisque and filet mignon are amazing. Always a great wait staff. All around grand slam every time!
Watched Ryder Cup 2025 with amazing European fans!
Great place. Good food. Solid pour of Guinness. Good place to watch live music.

Loved this place.
Right next door to our hotel and over thirty draft beers, awesome.

I found your business on Google Maps.
I‚Äôm Martins from Nigeria and I‚Äôve been trying to connect with honest business owners to offer online help with small tasks, Any tasks.
Let me know if I can be of any help to you guys.
Not here yet! Will update when they open if they are actually putting a place here.
Great late night food and a beer
We had a wonderful time visiting with old and new friends. It is a great casual place to spend time and relax with a drink.
Nice and quiet place to drink a Guinness
Amazing
Stopped in for a drink it was hot and muggy in NY. Great selection of beer and it waa cold!  Decided to order a bite to eat. The Shepard pie was a perfect portion but felt like it needed more flavor.

By pure luck, we walked into Connolly's and had one of our best meals ever. Many return visits later, service still impresses. With minor exceptions, the food was excellent. Get a few plates to share around the table. I endorsed this good spot to many.
Great place for a pint right out of times square
A favorite for a meal before or after a show. Affordable and good food. Service is always nice.
My favourite go to Irish pub when I‚Äôm done working good place to relax have a great beer and delicious food
Ein Pub wir man ihn sich w√ºnscht. Daumen hoch.
The best kept secret.
Perfect place for after theatre drinks & food.

Roof top is great.

beer selection is good.

Always come here while in town
Uprzejma i wyrozumia≈Ça obs≈Çuga. Guiness pyszny. Polecam
Friendly staff, The food was good. Bangers and mash a must. Lots of taps and liquor.  More reasonably priced than most.
Cracking bar,nice staff, good beer selection, menu looks good , loads of TV"s for sports. all round brilliant.

Lovely place to visit if youre a tourist. Food is great and the beer taps are just amazing. Servers are really kind and funny.

Sasha and Ronan really made our evening a spectacular one.  The service was great, the ambiance was casual and homey.  The dim lighting maybe hiding a lot more than it seems, as the whole place needs a bit of a cleaning, and there was a funky smell as you sat at the bar.

The food was not bad, I enjoyed the Shepherd's Pie the best.

The Bangers were over cooked, fried to an almost burnt and dried out texture, and the mashed potatoes served with it, were under seasoned, however, I enjoyed the sauce & onions.

The Fish & Chips were not the best I've had, the batter itself was heavy, and it was a bit burnt as well.

I figure the kitchen was trying to close, and they wanted to kick the orders out quickly, thus some of our dishes were burnt.

Drinks were good here!

Overall, solid experience but nothing to call home for. Standard pub with the conventional selections, exactly what you‚Äôd expect.

Went on a Saturday after 5pm and was seated promptly for four people. Most of the tables were packed by that point so we lucked out.

Food: Not a huge menu but they have what you‚Äôd expect: fish and chips, sheppard‚Äôs pie, chicken pot pie, burgers, corn beef, etc. We got nachos to start, and mains: the Reuben sandwich, fish and chips, and turkey burger. All were fine- not the best and not the worst. Prices were a bit high for the quality, but you‚Äôd expect as much in Times Square area.

Drinks: The noticeable difference is that they have over 40 beers on tap. We got the Connolly‚Äôs Red Ales and they were pretty good.

Service: Pretty good for a packed house. Prompt to sit, drinks came within reasonable time, food came fairly short after too.

Atmosphere: Exactly what you‚Äôd expect for an Irish pub. They have funky door handles so that was an interesting difference.

If you‚Äôre looking for a true taste of Ireland in the heart of NYC, Connolly‚Äôs Pub is it.
We stopped in for a traditional Irish breakfast and left feeling like we had just visited friends in Dublin. The breakfast was absolutely delicious ‚Äî perfectly cooked eggs, hearty sausages, crispy bacon, tomatoes, and beans, all washed down with a perfectly poured pint of Guinness.

What really made the experience unforgettable was Barry, the owner. He welcomed us like old friends, shared stories, and even gave us a little tour of his beautiful hotel next door. The tartan seat covers, Irish d√©cor, and cozy atmosphere brought me right back to my honeymoon in Ireland ‚Äî a place that still feels like home to me.

I even fell in love with the coffee mugs‚Ä¶ and brought a couple home! ‚òï

If you want warm hospitality, delicious food, and a genuine Irish experience without leaving New York, Connolly‚Äôs Pub is a must.

This is a really cool spot. It is aesthetically pleasing and exciting to see. They have draft handles as faucets in bathroom and kegs as a sink - that IS really cool and  creative. The staff was welcoming and everyone went above and beyond. The serve was kind, professional, efficient and he and the rest of the servers and bussers continually checked on us and other tables. They work as a team.

The ambiance is lovely. They okay music but we went during a championship game so game was playing which was the reason for us going in the first place. TVs everywhere. The prices are reasonable. There is a great selection of menu items and plenty of Irish dishes.

We ordered the spicy wings, pot pie and fries. The fries are amazing! Nice and airy and crispy and cooked to perfection. The pot pie was good but I personally like a more chicken knorr or poultry seasoning flavoring which I felt lacked. Overall just okay for my liking. The fried were good. Fresh and piping hot.

Great place just off time square (one block) wit a great vibe. We settled on their roof top bar that‚Äôs closed off with AC but there‚Äôs an outdoor are for smokers. I highly recommend this place.

Great pub, super friendly staff, great beer and whiskey selection, what else could you ask for? Came in on a Friday late afternoon and the upstairs bar was nice and quiet. Had great conversation and ended up staying for a couple more beers than we intended because we were relaxed and enjoying the atmosphere.

A great place to book your live show. John, the sound professional, is terrific to work with and knows his business. Decent back line, the audience was very happy with the mix, and we as the presenters had a terrific time. Thank you everyone on staff for making our showcase wonderful.

This was our second time at Connolly‚Äôs and it was just as good as the first. Our niece met us here, and she arrived first. Got a comfortable booth with excellent wait staff!

Food was good and plentiful. Niece and Husband had the Irish stew, and I had the Chicken Cheese Quesadilla. We left food behind because we were full & had no safe way to bring leftovers to our hotels for tomorrow‚Äôs snack.

The place is beautiful, warm & comfortable. We didn‚Äôt feel rushed at all. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

We had dinner at Connolly‚Äôs near Times Square today as a family of five. I had reserved a table in advance, though the restaurant was only moderately busy when we arrived.

We ordered Fish & Chips, three Gaelic Burgers, and a chicken dish for our youngest. The food was okay ‚Äî I‚Äôd rate it as average at best. Unfortunately, the service left much to be desired. The staff was inattentive and borderline unfriendly. We had to ask multiple times for drinks we had already ordered.

To make matters worse, a 20% gratuity was automatically added to the bill, making it impossible to reflect the poor service with the tip. We‚Äôve been traveling in the U.S. for 12 days now, and this was by far the weakest service experience we‚Äôve had.

If you‚Äôre looking for better options near Times Square, I highly recommend Brooklyn Diner or Friedman‚Äôs ‚Äî both miles ahead in terms of quality and hospitality.

We stayed next door at the 45 Time Square Hotel and ate there twice. The staff was courteous, especially the young lady from Ireland...I forgot her name. The food was delicious, especially my ü•û breakfast.

I've had a terrific time here at St. Patrick's Day, but not good on a recent trip where the place was practically empty. If I didn't know to ask for upstairs seating, I would have been relegated to the dark downstairs. Thankfully, someone overheard and interceded because the front of house folks were not communicating well. I initially had a wonderful server upstairs, but a big party was coming in so I was moved and forgotten. I had to track someone down to remind them I had asked for water on this blazing hot day. I appreciated that they found a spot for me near a TV as requested. The Margarita flatbread had some sauce on it, absolutely no crushed tomatoes as described, and just little bits of shredded basil. No one ever came back to check  and I finally found another server so I could pay and get out of there. I had asked the server if something had gone wrong between moving my heat and also commented that the food was not as described and was just told she was sorry for my experience. Never again.

Das Essen war sehr gut und das Ambiente war ebenfalls klasse. Ein toller Irish Pub. Allerdings ging ein Luftzug, von der T√ºr, durch den Laden, dass wir am Ende in unseren Jacken am Tisch sa√üen und gegessen haben. Abgesehen davon, Top.
Great bar this, ticks all the boxes for me. Friendly staff, nice pint and an amazing traditional Irish breakfast. Would highly recommend.

Me encanto el bar. El lugar  mucho no puedo decir de la comida porque solo com√≠ unos quesitos. Unos sticks de queso con una saliste vienen 5 o 6 por porci√≥n con una salsa. Pasamos a tomar una cerveza simplemente ya a conocer el lugar. El lugar eso hermoso. Bien ambientado. Buena m√∫sica y muchas pantallas de tv con deportes  . Espero volver.

After almost 10 years, it was great to get to experience this fine establishment with my family and I'm so glad we did.
The service here is brilliant with its friendly staff and flowing coffee.
Bernie made a fuss over my niece each time we came in and gave her some Connollys merch, he ever got her to be posted on their Instagram page.
The breakfast was a hit every time.
I highly recommend the French toast. It comes with fresh fruit and a bowl of maple syrup and it tastes so good.
The best French toast I've ever had.

Great Irish pub for the season of St.Patrick. location is great, a block from time square. The potatoes leak soup was amazing as was the Shepards pie. The service was great too, very quick and attentive without being overbearing in any way. Give traditional Irish pub vibes and great selection of beer and whiskey
Hoghly recommend!

Stopped in on a Saturday night after a comedy show and sat at the bar upstairs. First time here and it was pretty busy. I just wanted to get a quick bite to eat before I headed back to Jersey and I‚Äôm glad I stopped at Connolly‚Äôs. I was craving chicken wings so I ordered the mild buffalo wings and an Angry Orchard. The wings were so damn good!! The service was great as well and the Irish accent of my bartender was the icing on the cake! Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

We were there at late night so kitchen was already closed but it was still great time spent there. Make sure to try draft Guiness. Great thanks to Harry that took care of us. Will visit again for sure.

This was a great place to hang out waiting for a show to start. The drinks and food were reasonably priced. My Ruben sandwich was delicious. The bartender was helpful but didn't loom. He was also Irish, which was a nice surprise. It's just off Times Square, less than a block, but doesn't have any of that frenzied energy.
We made a short stop at Connelly's because I wanted to try their cider (I'm not a big drinker but still) it was lovely. Great atmosphere too

The service was impeccable. The coziness of the restaurant was great. When walking in, it was hard to find where to sit. Each floor told us to go to another floor which was frustrating. Our waiter ended up being great. The food was mediocre. The chicken pot pie was okay. The cesear salad was alright. The spinach dip was not good at all unfortunately.
Lovely clean pub and wonderful burgers, fries, and brews. Good N/A beer selection, too. Server was attentive and friendly.

The doorman really made this an enjoyable entrance and exit for us.  Funny guy with a great sense of humor.   The food is good and the place has three floors, with live music the night we visited (cover charge was $15).

Per caso mentre passeggiavamo sulla 45th Street, abbiamo letto sull‚Äôinsegna del pub che c‚Äôera un roof. E cos√¨ siamo entrati. Pub su pi√π  piani, enorme sala al piano  e poi al primo piano altra sala, si sale su fino al secondo piano su delle scale in legno classiche da tipico Pub irlandese!! Alla fine ci si ritrova in una sala con vetrate sulla street, con un bel terrazzino. Ampio bancone con davvero un‚Äôottima scelta di birre  a prezzi ragionevoli. Servizio cordialissimo e simpatico. Una bellissima scoperta. Bagno super creativo e molto pulito!! Posto davvero bello!!

A very nice place for a quick stop. Nice salads, fair portions, however, very aloof staff. Service could be better - more interactive, friendly & less indifferent to customers. Good music and not so distractive tv. I‚Äôd say a 3.5 stars place .

Awesome little Irish pub.  We visited a couple times due to close proximity to our hotel.  Drinks on the 4th floor roof was kind of fun just to be outside and look down the street.  We ate here as well and enjoyed the food.  Great menu.  Fun place.

Quite impressive place!!! Four floors of dining experience blocks away from Times Square. The first floor appears to be what you think of when you think Irish Pub...host had Irish accent lol, good bar atmosphere. Third floor had 3 bands playing from 8pm to midnight with a $15 cover. The music was not my style but you cannot beat that price for live music in the city. The wings were amazing and the vibe was fun. Fourth floor was by far the best. There was a great sports feel to the floor with soccer on many large tvs and larger family oriented parties dining. There is an outside deck you can walk out on that gives a great view of Times Square and the cool neon light!  I found all the people working here to be friendly and helpful. I would imagine it's a blast in mid March!!!
